title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 25 July 2016 - XWiki
content:
<xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
03:04 <jonesmeier> has quit  
03:06 <jonesmeier> has joined #xwiki  
06:55 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:54 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:54 <vmassol> has quit  
08:55 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:55 <vmassol> good morning  
09:02 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
09:03 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:20 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:24 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:51 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
09:52 <martinus-> good morning  
10:10 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
10:10 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
10:12 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:17 <edvorg> has joined #xwiki  
10:24 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:50 <tmortagne>   I guys, I will upgrade l10n this afternoon, if you want to translate stuff better do it this morning because the upgrade will take quite a while  
10:50 <tmortagne> this afternoon: in about 3 hours  
10:53 <evalica> tmortagne:  I need the l10n for the release  
10:53 <evalica> of 8.2  
10:54 <tmortagne> evalica: you need it up update translation which you could do this morning for example  
10:55 <tmortagne> it's ok if translations are not updated 5 seconds before the actual release  
10:57 <evalica> ok … then I'm starting it now  
11:37 <cjd> has quit  
11:37 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
11:40 <vmassol> evalica: I think we should translate in French the 2 new tip panel content, WDYT?  
11:40 <vmassol> (I could do it)  
11:40 <evalica> tmortagne: translations done  
11:40 <tmortagne> evalica: ok  
11:41 <evalica> vmassol: I already did the step …  
11:41 <vmassol> you think it's not an issue that on the homepage there'll be some English translations (in a French wiki)?  
11:42 <evalica> …. I'm sure there are other places too that are not translated  
11:42 <vmassol> sure but home page...  
11:43 <evalica> vmassol: if you want to do it - do it fast .. although this would delay the release  
11:44 <evalica> also I would change the dates too… since they affected the translation script…with the modified date  
11:44 <evalica> the pages appear to have translations changed, but only the date is changed...  
11:44 <evalica> I don't want to go in this discussion… since it's a bit late  
11:45 <vmassol> that's a bug of l10n, not of our practice  
11:45 <vmassol> we need to change the date because it's normal  
11:45 <evalica> vincent, so it's always been our practice to not modify the dates.. but maybe other devs could back me up  
11:45 <vmassol> for me not changing the date is ab ug  
11:45 <vmassol> \*bug  
11:45 <vmassol> because you're saying that the change done was there since the last update date  
11:45 <vmassol> whici s obviously plain wrong  
11:45 <vmassol> \*which  
11:46 <evalica> so let me know when the translations are done for French so I can redo the Translation step…  
11:47 <evalica> tmortagne: we need more time for l10n  
11:48 <vmassol> done  
11:48 <vmassol> (translation done)  
11:48 <vmassol> thanks  
11:48 <vmassol> you could only import this file  
11:48 <vmassol> http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Platform/HelpTranslations?language=fr  
11:49 <vmassol> sorry about the delay, I should have added the translations yesteray..  
11:52 <evalica> vmassol: done manually  
11:54 <evalica> [Release] 8.2: starting the release in 2 min  
11:57 <vmassol> evalica: ok, thanks  
12:21 <evalica> Starting ...  
13:20 <edvorg> has quit  
15:02 <tmortagne> [WARN] Putting l10n down for upgrade, since it's a pre 4.0 and there is lots of pages and objects it should take ages to execute migrations  
16:13 <evalica1> has joined #xwiki  
16:15 <evalica> has quit  
16:35 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
16:40 <vmassol1> hi everyone  
16:40 <vmassol1> there's a broken link on http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/  
16:40 <vmassol1> AJAX and JSON tutorial  
16:41 <vmassol1> @Enygma`: I see you added it  
16:41 <vmassol1> maybe you can fix the link?  
16:42 <cjd> Mr tmortagne, do you happen to know what happens if you call parseContent() and oldRendering is not currently installed ?  
16:43 <cjd> does it return to you what you gave it or does it throw ?  
16:43 <cjd> I'm asking because of this: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/objects/classes/DBListClass.java#L316  
16:44 <tmortagne> cjd: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/internal/render/DefaultOldRendering.java#L185  
16:45 <cjd> ok so just shove everything through velocity and call it a day  
16:46 <cjd> btw there was a performance optimization done in OldRendering by Lukasz which scanned for $ and # and it skipped velocity execution if they were not there  
16:46 <cjd> he implemented it because he did some profiling and found that (for whatever reason) oldRendering was hot  
16:47 <cjd> might be a good idea to reimplement it here since there are all these weird calls to parseContent() in places one does not expect  
16:47 <cjd> IIRC he proved that his patch improved perf because we didn't believe that scanning for # and $ is faster than letting velocity do it  
16:50 <tmortagne> if there is call to parseContent remaining they should be replaced  
16:50 <cjd> Also not to waste your time but what was the logic of returning "" on error rather than the original content ?  
16:51 <cjd> velocity usually has a garbage-in-garbage-out approach to bad syntax and this will make query debugging a bit more annoying  
16:57 <evalica1> is now known as <evalica>  
16:58 <tmortagne> cjd: I can't tell you that, this logic is older than my time  
16:58 <cjd> ok got it  
17:03 <lkrejci> has quit  
17:11 <Pbas> Hi, a silly question: in my velocity code I have a hashMap like this:  
17:11 <Pbas> {"MyKey":"Value","AnotherOne":"ValueTwo"} and I didn't manage to sort it  
17:11 <Pbas> I tested #set ($MySortedMap = $collectionstool.getSortedMap() ) without success  
17:11 <Pbas> Any idea?  
17:11 <Pbas> (I build my hashMap)  
17:12 <woshilapin> I don't get why you would want to sort a map?  
17:12 <woshilapin> Maybe what you want is only sort the keys?  
17:12 <tmortagne> has quit  
17:12 <vmassol1> hey hi woshilapin :) how's life?  
17:12 <Pbas> to reorder a glossary  
17:12 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
17:12 <woshilapin> Hi vmassol :-)  
17:13 <woshilapin> I thought Map was a kind of structure unsort by nature  
17:13 <Pbas> I read some entries in a doc, put them in a hashmap to reorder them  
17:13 <woshilapin> But then, I'll probably need to read a bit more if there is SortedMap :-)  
17:14 <Pbas> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ScriptingDocumentation/?url=http:%2F%2Fnexus.xwiki.org%2Fnexus%2Fservice%2Flocal%2Frepositories%2Fpublic%2Farchive%2Forg%2Fxwiki%2Fcommons%2Fxwiki-commons-velocity%2F7.4.2%2Fxwiki-commons-velocity-7.4.2-javadoc.jar%2F!%2Forg%2Fxwiki%2Fvelocity%2Ftools%2FCollectionsTool.html%23getSortedMap%28%29  
17:15 <woshilapin> Yep, I'm discovering that  
17:15 <woshilapin> Thanks  
17:15 <Pbas> I didn't manage to use http://velocity.apache.org/tools/devel/apidocs/org/apache/velocity/tools/generic/SortTool.html neither  
17:16 <Pbas> because it seems that sorttools didn't sorting by keay name  
17:16 <vmassol> Pbas: see http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/SortedMap/  
17:17 <Pbas> wow the bot is angry becasue my question  
17:17 <vmassol> http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/edit/Main/SortedMap/WebHome?editor=wiki  
17:17 <vmassol> actually: http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/SortedMap/?viewer=code  
17:18 <Pbas> thxs Vincent  
17:19 <woshilapin> Indeed, was not straightforward how to use it  
17:19 <vmassol> really?  
17:19 <vmassol> getSortedMap returns a sorted map instance  
17:19 <vmassol> it doesn't sort  
17:19 <vmassol> (since you don't pass anything to it, it cannot sort anywyay ;))  
17:20 <Pbas> It seem it is what I did  
17:20 <woshilapin> Yep, that's usually not what I expect from a method called getSortedMap(), more from a newSortedMap()  
17:20 <Pbas> but if I put some entries, it must be sorted  
17:20 <woshilapin> But maybe it's only me :-)  
17:20 <vmassol> yeah "get" is not the best term  
17:20 <vmassol> I agree  
17:20 <vmassol> note that it has the advantage that you can write:  
17:21 <vmassol> $collectiontools.sortedMap  
17:21 <woshilapin> Ah yes, Velocity!  
17:22 <cjd> IMO maps should preserve order that things were added - which stands to reason you should be able to sort them like lists  
17:22 <vmassol> that's LinkedHashMap cjd  
17:22 <vmassol> (but not HashMap)  
17:23 <cjd> if you don't make that guarantee then you have indeterminent execution if you expose to the developer any kind of API like iterate over keys or keySet()  
17:23 <cjd> /nod  
17:31 <Pbas> Thxs both it seem it's working (I did a research all day to simply sort this hash map)  http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/SortedMap/test2  
17:42 <mflorea> has quit  
17:44 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
17:51 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
17:51 <vmassol> has quit  
18:06 <Slashman> has quit  
18:50 <ClemensR> has quit  
18:55 <evalica1> has joined #xwiki  
18:58 <evalica> has quit  
19:02 <evalica1> has quit  
19:10 <Enygma`> has quit  
19:19 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
19:39 <mflorea> has quit  
19:50 <mbuschman> has joined #xwiki  
19:51 <mbuschman> Hello: Has anyone noticed an issue with 8.2 and CKEditor? Using the jetty zipfile, it's not possible to edit any pages: I get a spinning ball forever.  
19:52 <mbuschman> The raw wiki syntax editor does work.  
19:52 <vmassol1> mbuschman: can you try clearing your browser cache?  
19:52 <mbuschman> Good idea.  
19:52 <vmassol1> (force clear)  
19:52 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
19:56 <mbuschman> Yep, caching problem. I went to another browser. Just set up 8.2, Cache from 8.1 was causing the issue. I didn't assign my account the admin permission in 8.2, but it did have it in 8.1.  
19:57 <vmassol> ok cool  
19:57 <mbuschman> Thank you very much!  
19:57 <vmassol> np  
19:57 <mbuschman> Bye!  
19:58 <vmassol> let us know how you like the 8.2 versiàn  
19:58 <vmassol> \*version  
19:58 <mbuschman> Will do!  
19:58 <vmassol> thx  
19:58 <mbuschman> So far, it's really cool.  
19:58 <mbuschman> I'm nearly ready to deploy 8.2 to replace mediawiki.  
19:58 <vmassol> great!  
19:58 <vmassol> there's now a mediawiki importer too  
19:58 <mbuschman> Syntax conversion has been an interesting process. I've got about...  
19:59 <mbuschman> ....600 lines of python...  
19:59 <mbuschman> hahah :)  
19:59 <vmassol> see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/MediaWiki/MediaWiki+XML/  
19:59 <vmassol> :)  
19:59 <mbuschman> Wow, this is REALLY good timing.  
20:00 <vmassol> it's quite new so we're eager to get feedback about it  
20:00 <mbuschman> I put in 14 hours yesterday getting the last bits of the syntax conversion right, uploading attachments...  
20:00 <vmassol> oops sorry :)  
20:00 <mbuschman> I mean, the timing is funny, but I'm glad that it's not just me and my crazy python code.  
20:00 <mbuschman> Frankly, the timing is amazing; I'm glad CKEditor is now available in a stable release.  
20:01 <vmassol> yup that should please our users  
20:01 <mbuschman> Very much so; the copy/paste feature is awesome. I've got a few users who want to copy/paste images for documenting workflows, so that's incredibly useful.  
20:01 <vmassol> would be great if you can provide feedback on the list after you play with it more. We love feedback. Good or bad! And all ideas toi improve xwiki as more thab welcome  
20:02 <vmassol> \*are more than welcome  
20:02 <mbuschman> Absolutely. I'm really glad you mentioned the importer - I'll give it a go now.  
20:02 <vmassol> cool  
20:02 <vmassol> tmortagne is the creator of it and he's on this chat every day  
20:03 <vmassol> (it's after work now in France that's why he's logged off but you can come back tomorrow earlier in the day if you need help)  
20:04 <mbuschman> I see. Frankly, the fact that there are responsive, (and polite!) developers on IRC is great.  
20:04 <vmassol> :)  
20:04 <mbuschman> I'm going to go read through the document you linked and test out the converter.  
20:05 <vmassol> k  
20:05 <mbuschman> I've got about 65 pages with 30ish revisions each, and some attachments.  
20:05 <vmassol> cool, I'm eager to see how it goes  
21:13 <mbuschman> Well, I didn't get a chance to test the mediawiki import...  
21:13 <mbuschman> but I did run through the process of importing a Word document as a wiki page, which worked out pretty well. Minor formatting issues.  
21:13 <mbuschman> I found https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QP\_N5U\_GIJY  
21:13 <mbuschman> (how to activate OpenOffice server)  
21:14 <mbuschman> which was previously unknown to me, good documentation, thank you to whoever made that.  
21:40 <acotiuga> has quit  
22:25 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
22:27 <vmassol1> mbuschman: cool. I've added a link to it from http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Office+Importer+Application#HTutorials  
22:30 <mbuschman> Cool, thanks!  
23:04 <sdumitriu> has quit  
23:18 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki
